8.26.19  1:48 pm   Will you give a try to the twinkle twinkle little star harmonization challenge? would be awesome....

      harmonization is so closely dependent on rhythm, and rhythm is so dependent on harmonization, and context is so dependent on all of them, and they all to each other. i am a little skeptical that there could be a challenge in just one, without also drawing in all the others fully and immediately

8.26.19  5:52 am   Why do some musicians use Em instead of C/E?

Em is like a poor musician's C/E when in the key of C.

That B note does not belong in C/E.

There is no B note in C/E.

      everyone can feel the difference, but not everyone may have identified how to produce that feel. can be your secret if nobody finds out

8.26.19  4:11 am   can you tell us what the "finder swap" is? i've been thinking about it for the past six months

      that's probably when you are working in a content creation program and you change one of the files it's using outside the program while the program is using it. and watch all your subsequent work take effect now on a different, changed version of the starting file(s). this could be useful if the program is too bogged down by a heavy project, might be quicker to just make nudges to the files outside the program, where editing will be quicker and more responsive. and then swap it in and re-render. also extremely useful for making re-edits for different aspect ratio

8.26.19  1:41 am   In these modern times, it can be taxing trying to manage the image one presents of themselves. With social media causing people to always be selling themselves, and sculpting their "perfect" personality. We often get lost considering what other people will think of us without stopping to ask "How do I think of myself" Everyone goes through some amount of the same thing, but never pays attention to that. I guess what I'm asking is can you open this pickle jar for me?
